PacketDefinitions.Description: This file contains all packet definitions for packets which are sent from game server to client.

Structure.Name: StoredItem
Structure.Description: The structure for a stored item, e.g. in the inventory or vault.

Packet.Name: GameServerEntered
Packet.SentWhen: After a game client has connected to the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: It shows the login dialog.

Packet.Name: LoginResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the login request has been processed by the server.
Packet.CausedReaction: Shows the result. When it was successful, the client proceeds by sending a character list request.

Enum.Name: LoginResult
Enum.Description: The result of a login request.

EnumValue.Name: InvalidPassword
EnumValue.Description: The password was wrong.

EnumValue.Name: Okay
EnumValue.Description: The login succeeded.

EnumValue.Name: AccountInvalid
EnumValue.Description: The account is invalid.

EnumValue.Name: AccountAlreadyConnected
EnumValue.Description: The account is already connected.

EnumValue.Name: ServerIsFull
EnumValue.Description: The server is full.

EnumValue.Name: AccountBlocked
EnumValue.Description: The account is blocked.

EnumValue.Name: WrongVersion
EnumValue.Description: The game client has the wrong version.

EnumValue.Name: ConnectionError
EnumValue.Description: An internal error occured during connection.

EnumValue.Name: ConnectionClosed3Fails
EnumValue.Description: Connection closed because of three failed login requests.

EnumValue.Name: NoChargeInfo
EnumValue.Description: There is no payment information.

EnumValue.Name: SubscriptionTermOver
EnumValue.Description: The subscription term is over.

EnumValue.Name: SubscriptionTimeOver
EnumValue.Description: The subscription time is over.

EnumValue.Name: TemporaryBlocked
EnumValue.Description: The account is temporarily blocked.

EnumValue.Name: OnlyPlayersOver15Yrs
EnumValue.Description: Only players over 15 years are allowed to connect.

EnumValue.Name: BadCountry
EnumValue.Description: The client connected from a blocked country.

Packet.Name: LogoutResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the logout request has been processed by the server.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the result, the game client closes the game or changes to another selection screen.

Packet.Name: ChatMessage
Packet.SentWhen: A player sends a chat message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The message is shown in the chat box and above the character of the sender.

Enum.Name: ChatMessageType
Enum.Description: Defines the type of a chat message.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: The message is a normal chat message, e.g. public, within a party or guild.

EnumValue.Name: Whisper
EnumValue.Description: The message is sent privately to the receiving player.

Packet.Name: ExperienceGained
Packet.SentWhen: A player gained experience.
Packet.CausedReaction: The experience is added to the experience counter and bar.

Packet.Name: ApplyKeyConfiguration
Packet.SentWhen: When entering the game world with a character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client restores this configuration in its user interface.

Field.Name: Configuration
Field.Description: The binary data of the key configuration

Packet.Name: ItemAddedToInventory
Packet.SentWhen: A new item was added to the inventory.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client adds the item to the inventory user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemDropResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to drop an item of his inventory. This message is the response about the success of the request.
Packet.CausedReaction: If successful, the client removes the item from the inventory user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemPickUpRequestFailed
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to pick up an item from to ground to add it to his inventory, but it failed.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the reason, the game client shows a message.

EnumValue.Name: ItemStacked
EnumValue.Description: The picked up item was combined into an existing item of the players inventory. A separate durability update will be sent to the client.

EnumValue.Name: __MaximumInventoryMoneyReached
EnumValue.Description: The maximum inventory money has been reached, so the money wasn't picked up. Should not be used, because it's used in the InventoryMoneyUpdate message.

EnumValue.Name: General
EnumValue.Description: The general, non-specific reason. It just failed.

Packet.Name: InventoryMoneyUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: The players money amount of the inventory has been changed and needs an update.
Packet.CausedReaction: The money is updated in the inventory user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemMoved
Packet.SentWhen: An item in the inventory or vault of the player has been moved.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client updates the position of item in the user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemMoveRequestFailed
Packet.SentWhen: An item in the inventory or vault of the player could not be moved as requested by the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client restores the position of item in the user interface.

Packet.Name: CurrentHealthAndShield
Packet.SentWhen: Periodically, or if the current health or shield changed on the server side, e.g. by hits.
Packet.CausedReaction: The health and shield bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: MaximumHealthAndShield
Packet.SentWhen: When the maximum health changed, e.g. by adding stat points or changed items.
Packet.CausedReaction: The health and shield bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemConsumptionFailed
Packet.SentWhen: When the consumption of an item failed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client gets a feedback about a failed consumption, and allows for do further consumption requests.

Packet.Name: CurrentManaAndAbility
Packet.SentWhen: The currently available mana or ability has changed, e.g. by using a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: The mana and ability bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: MaximumManaAndAbility
Packet.SentWhen: The maximum available mana or ability has changed, e.g. by adding stat points.
Packet.CausedReaction: The mana and ability bar is updated on the game client user interface.

Packet.Name: ItemRemoved
Packet.SentWhen: The item has been removed from the inventory of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client removes the item in the inventory user interface.

Field.Name: InventorySlot
Field.Description: The affected slot of the item in the inventory.

Packet.Name: ConsumeItemWithEffect
Packet.SentWhen: The client requested to consume a special item, e.g. a bottle of Ale.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player is shown in a red color and has increased attack speed.

EnumValue.Name: Ale
EnumValue.Description: The player consumes a bottle of ale, usually 80 seconds effect time.

EnumValue.Name: RedemyOfLove
EnumValue.Description: The player consumes a redemy of love, usually 90 seconds effect time.

EnumValue.Name: PotionOfSoul
EnumValue.Description: The player consumes a potion of soul, usually 60 seconds effect time.

Packet.Name: ItemDurabilityChanged
Packet.SentWhen: The durability of an item in the inventory of the player has been changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client updates the item in the inventory user interface.

Field.Name: ByConsumption
Field.Description: true, if the change resulted from an item consumption; otherwise, false

Packet.Name: StoreItemList
Packet.SentWhen: The player opens a merchant npc or the vault. It's sent after the dialog was opened by another message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the items in the opened dialog.

Packet.Name: NpcItemBuyFailed
Packet.SentWhen: The request of buying an item from a NPC failed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client is responsive again. Without this message, it may stuck.

Packet.Name: ItemBought
Packet.SentWhen: The request of buying an item from a player or npc was successful.
Packet.CausedReaction: The bought item is added to the inventory.

Packet.Name: NpcItemSellResult
Packet.SentWhen: The result of a previous item sell request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The amount of specified money is set at the players inventory.

Packet.Name: PlayerShopSetItemPriceResponse
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to set a price for an item of the players shop.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item gets a price on the user interface.

Enum.Name: ItemPriceSetResult
Enum.Description: Describes the possible results of setting an item price in a player shop.

EnumValue.Name: Failed
EnumValue.Description: Failed, e.g. because the shop feature is deactivated

EnumValue.Name: Success
EnumValue.Description: The price has been set successfully

EnumValue.Name: ItemSlotOutOfRange
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the item slot was out of range

EnumValue.Name: ItemNotFound
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the item could not be found

EnumValue.Name: PriceNegative
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the price was negative

EnumValue.Name: ItemIsBlocked
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the item is blocked

EnumValue.Name: CharacterLevelTooLow
EnumValue.Description: Failed because the character level is too low (below level 6)

Packet.Name: PlayerShopItemSoldToPlayer
Packet.SentWhen: An item of the players shop was sold to another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is removed from the players inventory and a blue system message appears.

Packet.Name: CharacterList
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested it, usually after a successful login.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the available characters of the account.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Data of one character in the list.

Packet.Name: CharacterList075
Packet.SentWhen: After the game client requested it, usually after a successful login.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client shows the available characters of the account.

Structure.Name: CharacterData
Structure.Description: Data of one character in the list.

Packet.Name: CharacterCreationSuccessful
Packet.SentWhen: After the server successfully processed a character creation request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The new character is shown in the character list

Packet.Name: CharacterCreationFailed
Packet.SentWhen: After the server processed a character creation request without success.
Packet.CausedReaction: A message is shown that it failed.

Packet.Name: HeroStateChanged
Packet.SentWhen: After a the hero state of an observed character changed.
Packet.CausedReaction: The color of the name of the character is changed accordingly and a message is shown.

Packet.Name: SkillAdded
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got added to the skill list, e.g. by equipping an item or learning a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillRemoved
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got removed from the skill list, e.g. by removing an equipped item.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillListUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: Usually, when the player entered the game with a character. When skills get added or removed, this message is sent as well, but with a misleading count.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill list gets initialized.

Field.Name: Count
Field.Description: Mixed usage: Skill list count (when list). 0xFE when adding a skill, 0xFF when removing a Skill.

Structure.Name: SkillEntry
Structure.Description: Structure for a skill entry of the skill list.

Packet.Name: SkillAdded075
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got added to the skill list, e.g. by equipping an item or learning a skill.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillRemoved075
Packet.SentWhen: After a skill got removed from the skill list, e.g. by removing an equipped item.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill is added to the skill list on client side.

Packet.Name: SkillListUpdate075
Packet.SentWhen: Usually, when the player entered the game with a character. When skills get added or removed, this message is sent as well, but with a misleading count.
Packet.CausedReaction: The skill list gets initialized.

Field.Name: Count
Field.Description: Mixed usage: Skill list count (when list). 0xFE when adding a skill, 0xFF when removing a Skill.

Structure.Name: SkillEntry
Structure.Description: Structure for a skill entry of the skill list.

Packet.Name: CharacterFocused
Packet.SentWhen: After the client focused the character successfully on the server side.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client highlights the focused character.

Packet.Name: CharacterStatIncreaseResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the server processed a character stat increase request packet.
Packet.CausedReaction: If it was successful, adds a point to the requested stat type.

Packet.Name: CharacterDeleteResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the server processed a character delete response of the client.
Packet.CausedReaction: If successful, the character is deleted from the character selection screen. Otherwise, a message is shown.

Enum.Name: CharacterDeleteResult
Enum.Description: Result of a character delete request.

EnumValue.Name: Unsuccessful
EnumValue.Description: Deleting was not successful

EnumValue.Name: Successful
EnumValue.Description: Deleting was successful

EnumValue.Name: WrongSecurityCode
EnumValue.Description: Deleting was not successful because a wrong security code was entered

Packet.Name: CharacterLevelUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After a character leveled up.
Packet.CausedReaction: Updates the level (and other related stats) in the game client and shows an effect.

Packet.Name: CharacterInformation
Packet.SentWhen: After the character was selected by the player and entered the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The characters enters the game world.

Packet.Name: CharacterInformation075
Packet.SentWhen: After the character was selected by the player and entered the game.
Packet.CausedReaction: The characters enters the game world.

Packet.Name: CharacterInventory
Packet.SentWhen: The player entered the game or finished a trade.
Packet.CausedReaction: The user interface of the inventory is initialized with all of its items.

Packet.Name: InventoryItemUpgraded
Packet.SentWhen: An item in the inventory got upgraded by the player, e.g. by applying a jewel.
Packet.CausedReaction: The item is updated on the user interface.

Packet.Name: MasterStatsUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After entering the game with a master class character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The master related data is available.

Packet.Name: MasterSkillLevelUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After a master skill level has been changed (usually increased).
Packet.CausedReaction: The level is updated in the master skill tree.

Field.Name: MasterSkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the master skill on the clients master skill tree for the given character class.

Packet.Name: MasterSkillList
Packet.SentWhen: Usually after entering the game with a master character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The data is available in the master skill tree.

Structure.Name: MasterSkillEntry
Structure.Description: An entry in the master skill list.

Field.Name: MasterSkillIndex
Field.Description: The index of the master skill on the clients master skill tree for the given character class.

Enum.Name: MessageType
Enum.Description: Defines a type of a server message.

EnumValue.Name: GoldenCenter
EnumValue.Description: The message is shown as centered golden message in the client.

EnumValue.Name: BlueNormal
EnumValue.Description: The message is shown as a blue system message.

EnumValue.Name: GuildNotice
EnumValue.Description: The message is a guild notice, centered in green.

Packet.Name: GuildJoinRequest
Packet.SentWhen: A player requested to join a guild. This message is sent then to the guild master.
Packet.CausedReaction: The guild master gets a message box with the request popping up.

Packet.Name: GuildJoinResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After a guild master responded to a request of a player to join his guild. This message is sent back to the requesting player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The requester gets a corresponding message showing.

Enum.Name: GuildJoinRequestResult
Enum.Description: The result of the guild join request.

Packet.Name: GuildList
Packet.SentWhen: After a game client requested the list of players of his guild, which is usually the case when the player opens the guild dialog at the game client.
Packet.CausedReaction: The list of player is available at the client.

Structure.Name: GuildMember
Structure.Description: Contains the data of one guild member.

Packet.Name: GuildKickResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After a guild master sent a request to kick a player from its guild and the server processed this request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows a message depending on the result.

Enum.Name: GuildKickSuccess
Enum.Description: The result of the guild kick request.

Packet.Name: ShowGuildMasterDialog
Packet.SentWhen: After a player started talking to the guild master NPC and the player is allowed to create a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the guild master dialog.

Packet.Name: ShowGuildCreationDialog
Packet.SentWhen: After a player started talking to the guild master NPC and the player proceeds to create a guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The client shows the guild creation dialog.

Packet.Name: GuildCreationResult
Packet.SentWhen: After a player requested to create a guild at the guild master NPC.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the result, a message is shown.

Packet.Name: GuildMemberLeftGuild
Packet.SentWhen: A player left a guild. This message is sent to the player and all surrounding players.
Packet.CausedReaction: The player is not longer shown as a guild member.

Packet.Name: AssignCharacterToGuild
Packet.SentWhen: The server wants to visibly assign a player to a guild, e.g. when two players met each other and one of them is a guild member.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players. If the game client doesn't met a player of this guild yet, it will send another request to get the guild information.

Structure.Name: GuildMemberRelation
Structure.Description: Relation between a guild and a member.

Packet.Name: GuildInformation
Packet.SentWhen: A game client requested the (public) info of a guild, e.g. when it met a player of previously unknown guild.
Packet.CausedReaction: The players which belong to the guild are shown as guild players.

Packet.Name: VaultMoneyUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to move money between the vault and inventory.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the money values of vault and inventory.

Packet.Name: VaultClosed
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to close the vault, this confirmation is sent back to the client.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client closes the vault dialog.

Packet.Name: VaultProtectionInformation
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to open the vault.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client updates the UI to show the current vault protection state.

EnumValue.Name: Unprotected
EnumValue.Description: The vault is unprotected.

EnumValue.Name: Locked
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and locked. To move items or money, the player needs to unlock it.

EnumValue.Name: UnlockFailedByWrongPin
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and locked. The user-requested unlock failed by a wrong pin.

EnumValue.Name: SetPinFailedBecauseLock
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and locked and the player-requested pin setting failed because of the lock.

EnumValue.Name: Unlocked
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected, but was unlocked by the player.

EnumValue.Name: RemovePinFailedByWrongPassword
EnumValue.Description: The vault is protected and the player-requested pin removal failed by using the wrong password.

Packet.Name: MessengerInitialization
Packet.Caption: MUssenger initialization / friend list
Packet.SentWhen: After entering the game with a character.

Structure.Name: Friend
Structure.Description: The structure which contains the friend name and online state.

Field.Name: ServerId
Field.Description: The server id on which the player currently is online. 0xFF means offline.

Packet.Name: FriendAdded
Packet.SentWhen: After a friend has been added to the friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend appears in the friend list.

Field.Name: ServerId
Field.Description: The server id on which the player currently is online. 0xFF means offline.

Packet.Name: FriendRequest
Packet.SentWhen: After a player has requested to add another player as friend. This other player gets this message.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend request appears on the user interface.

Packet.Name: FriendDeleted
Packet.SentWhen: After a friend has been removed from the friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend is removed from the friend list.

Packet.Name: FriendOnlineStateUpdate
Packet.SentWhen: After a friend has been added to the friend list.
Packet.CausedReaction: The friend appears in the friend list.

Field.Name: ServerId
Field.Description: The server id on which the player currently is online. 0xFF means offline.

Packet.Name: LetterSendResponse
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to send a letter to another player.
Packet.CausedReaction: Depending on the result, the letter send dialog closes or an error message appears.

Enum.Name: LetterSendRequestResult
Enum.Description: Describes the result of a letter send request.

EnumValue.Name: TryAgain
EnumValue.Description: The letter wasn't sent because there was an internal problem. The user should try again.

EnumValue.Name: Success
EnumValue.Description: The letter was sent.

EnumValue.Name: MailboxFull
EnumValue.Description: The mailbox of the recipient is full.

EnumValue.Name: ReceiverNotExists
EnumValue.Description: The receiver does not exist.

EnumValue.Name: CantSendToYourself
EnumValue.Description: A letter can't be sent to yourself.

EnumValue.Name: NotEnoughMoney
EnumValue.Description: The sender doesn't have enough money to send a letter.

Packet.Name: AddLetter
Packet.SentWhen: After a letter has been received or after the player entered the game with a character.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter appears in the letter list.

Enum.Name: LetterState
Enum.Description: Describes the state of a letter.

EnumValue.Name: Read
EnumValue.Description: The letter was read before.

EnumValue.Name: Unread
EnumValue.Description: The letter wasn't read yet.

EnumValue.Name: New
EnumValue.Description: The letter is new (= was just sent by the sender) and wasn't read yet. It will notify the user about the received letter.

Packet.Name: OpenLetter
Packet.SentWhen: After the player requested to read a letter.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter is opened in a new dialog.

Packet.Name: RemoveLetter
Packet.SentWhen: After a letter has been deleted by the request of the player.
Packet.CausedReaction: The letter is removed from the letter list.

Packet.Name: ChatRoomConnectionInfo
Packet.SentWhen: The player is invited to join a chat room on the chat server.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client connects to the chat server and joins the chat room with the specified authentication data.

Packet.Name: FriendInvitationResult
Packet.SentWhen: The player requested to add another player to his friend list and the server processed this request.
Packet.CausedReaction: The game client knows if the invitation could be sent to the other player.

Enum.Name: GuildMemberRole
Enum.Description: Defines the role of a guild member.

EnumValue.Name: NormalMember
EnumValue.Description: The member is a normal member without special rights.

EnumValue.Name: BattleMaster
EnumValue.Description: The member is a battle master.

EnumValue.Name: GuildMaster
EnumValue.Description: The member is the guild master.

EnumValue.Name: Undefined
EnumValue.Description: The character is not a member, therefore the role is undefined.

EnumValue.Name: Normal
EnumValue.Description: The state of the character is normal.

EnumValue.Name: Banned
EnumValue.Description: The character is banned from the game.

EnumValue.Name: GameMaster
EnumValue.Description: The character is a game master.
